text: My name is Afri. This is the beginning of your chat with me.
I will be helping you figure out solutions to your learning challenges. Let’s have fun destroying problems
Can you help find the volume of the cone above? Round to the nearest tenth of a cubic centimeter.

From the figure, the radius of the cone is 88 cm and the height is 18 cm. The formula for the volume of a cone is, V = 1/3πr²h Substitute 8 for r and 18 for h. V = 1/3π (8) ² (18) To Simplify: V = 1/3π (64)(18)=384π≈1206.4 Therefore, the volume of the cone is about 1206.4 cubic centimeters.
